conclusion: To determine if the two objects have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \), we need to analyze the velocity-time graph for both objects.
The slope of the velocity-time graph gives the acceleration of the object.
At \( t = t_1 \), the velocity of Object A is zero.
The slope of the line representing Object A at \( t_1 \) is negative, indicating that Object A is decelerating.
At \( t = t_1 \), the velocity of Object B is also zero.
The slope of the line representing Object B at \( t_1 \) is positive, indicating that Object B is accelerating.
The slope of the line for Object A at \( t_1 \) is negative.
The slope of the line for Object B at \( t_1 \) is positive.
Since the slopes are different (one is negative and the other is positive), the accelerations of the two objects at \( t_1 \) are not the same.
No, the two objects do not have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \).
